summary:
The Algerian War (1954-1962) was a fight for independence from France. Algerian rebels, led by the FLN, used guerrilla tactics. The war was brutal, with war crimes committed by both sides. It led to political changes in France, including the end of the Fourth Republic.

After years of fighting, France agreed to Algeria's independence. The Ã‰vian Accords were signed in 1962, and Algeria officially became independent. Many European-Algerians fled to France, causing social issues. The war resulted in the deaths of hundreds of thousands of Algerians, French soldiers, and European civilians.
title: Algerian War
